problem_text:
A formation F is called radical in a class H if F ⊆ H and in every H-group the product of any two normal F-subgroups belongs to F. Let M be the class of all saturated hereditary formations of finite groups such that the formation of all finite supersoluble groups is radical in every element of M. Is it true that M has the largest (by inclusion) element?
A. F. Vasil’ev, L. A. Shemetkov
